data.title: Carlota Joaquina of Spain
data.text:
Doña Carlota Joaquina of Spain (Carlota Joaquina Teresa Cayetana; 25 Aprile 1775 – 7 Januar 1830), wis bi birth a member o the Spanish branch of the House of Bourbon as well as an Infanta o Spain before becoming Queen consort of Portugal and the Algarves by marriage to John VI of Portugal.

Issue[edit]

Infanta Maria Teresa, Princess of Beira (29 April 1793 – 17 January 1874) married twice and had issue.

Infante Francisco António, Prince of Beira (21 March 1795 – 11 June 1801) died in infancy

Infanta Maria Isabel of Portugal (19 May 1797 – 26 December 1818) married Ferdinand VII of Spain and had issue.

Pedro I of Brazil (12 October 1798 – 24 September 1834) married and had issue.

Infanta Maria Francisca of Portugal (22 April 1800 – 4 September 1834) married Infante Carlos, Count of Molina

Infanta Isabel Maria of Portugal (4 July 1801 – 22 April 1876) regent of Portugal from 1826 till 1828, but never married.

Miguel I of Portugal (26 October 1802 – 14 November 1866)

Infanta Maria da Assunção of Portugal (25 June 1805 – 7 January 1834) never married.

Infanta Ana de Jesus Maria of Portugal 23 October 1806 – 22 June 1857) married Nuno José Severo de Mendoça Rolim de Moura Barreto, Duke of Loulé and had issue.

Titles and styles[edit]

25 April 1775 - 8 May 1785 Her Royal Highness The Most Serene Lady The Infanta Dona Carlota Joaquina of Spain.

8 May 1785 - 11 September 1788 Her Highness Infanta Carlota Joaquina of Portugal.

11 September 1788 - 20 March 1816 Her Royal Highness The Princess of Brazil, Duchess of Braganza.

20 March 1816 - 15 November 1825 Her Most Faithful Majesty The Queen of the United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves.

12 October 1822 - 15 November 1825 Titular Queen of Brazil.

15 November 1825 - 10 March 1826 Her Imperial and Most Faithful Majesty The Queen of Portugal and the Algarves, Empress of Brazil.

10 March - 2 May 1826 Her Imperial and Most Faithful Majesty The Queen Mither of Portugal and the Algarves, Empress of Brazil.

2 May 1826 - 7 January 1830 Her Imperial and Most Faithful Majesty The Queen Dowager of Portugal and the Algarves, Empress Dowager of Brazil

29 August 1825 - 7 January 1830 Titular Empress of Brazil

Honours[edit]

Dame of the Order of Noble Ladies of Queen Maria Luisa (Spain)

Dame of the Order of the Starry Cross (Austria)
